fullContent:
# Chief Intelligence Officer - Daily Brief
**Topic**: Latest global political and military news
**Time**: 2026/2/7 18:15

## Situation Overview
Welcome to the Daily News Channel, I'm Joe. It's February 7, 2026. In the past 24 hours, the global security situation has witnessed a series of landmark yet challenging changes. This episode focuses on "Great Power Rivalry and Security Restructuring." The most worrying news is the formal expiration of the New Strategic Arms Reduction Treaty (New START), the last pillar of US-Russia nuclear arms control that had lasted for half a century. This has instantly plunged the world into a nuclear control "vacuum," triggering deep concerns about an arms race. At the same time, we have also seen glimmers of diplomatic maneuvering: the US and Russia restarted high-level military dialogue in Abu Dhabi after a four-year hiatus, and the US and Iran also engaged in indirect negotiations in Oman, albeit in a "good" atmosphere, but with lingering differences. In the Indo-Pacific region, live-fire exercises in the South China Sea and the undercurrents of defense between China, India, and Russia are reshaping the global strategic landscape. Please see the detailed report below.

## Key Intelligence
### 1. The US and Russia reached an agreement in Abu Dhabi to formally resume high-level military dialogue mechanisms.
- **Time**: 2026-02-06
- **Source**: Realtime News, CGTN, ICRT
- **Summary**: According to reports, the US and Russian militaries held a groundbreaking meeting in Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates, on Thursday. General Alexis Grinkovich, Commander of US European Command, represented the US side. The two sides reached an agreement to formally re-establish a high-level military dialogue channel. This marks the first time Washington and Moscow have resumed such direct military communication since the outbreak of the Russia-Ukraine conflict in 2022. Reports indicate that while the two sides had previously maintained a de-conflict hotline, this agreement signifies a substantial return to high-level trust and communication. A US military statement emphasized that this move aims to reduce military miscalculations and prevent local conflicts from escalating into global risks. This breakthrough comes against the backdrop of several recent direct phone calls between the leaders of the two countries.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Realtime News, CGTN, Adaderana.lk](https://www.icrt.com.tw/info_list01.php?&mlevel1=6&mlevel2=12)

### 2. Is the era of nuclear control over over? The New START Treaty between the US and Russia has officially expired.
- **Time**: 2026-02-06
- **Source**: CGTN, Adaderana.lk, Il Sole 24 Ore
- **Summary**: According to CGTN and several international media outlets, the New Strategic Arms Reduction Treaty (New START), the last legal pillar limiting strategic nuclear weapons between the United States and Russia, will officially expire on February 5, 2026. Because the two sides failed to reach an alternative agreement before the deadline, for the first time in over half a century, the world's two major nuclear powers will operate their nuclear arsenals without treaty constraints. UN Secretary-General António Guterres issued an urgent warning, stating that the risk of nuclear weapons use has reached its highest point in decades. Although there are reports that the US and Russia are discussing a six-month informal compliance agreement in Abu Dhabi, the Kremlin stated that it is difficult to imagine how disarmament commitments can be maintained in the absence of formal legal documents, and the international community is widely concerned that a new round of nuclear arms race has begun.
- **References**:
  - [1] [CGTN, Adaderana.lk](https://www.cgtn.com/politics)

### 3. Indirect negotiations between the US, Iran, and Oman have made progress, but Iran firmly refuses to halt high-enrichment uranium.
- **Time**: 2026-02-07
- **Source**: Xinhua, CGTN, Al Arabiya
- **Summary**: According to reports, the United States and Iran held a new round of indirect talks on Friday, mediated by Muscat, Oman. The rare attendance of U.S. Central Command Admiral Brad Cooper highlighted the close connection between the negotiations and Middle East security. President Trump subsequently described the talks as "very positive" and planned to continue early next week. However, Iranian Foreign Minister Araqchi made it clear that while the talks were a "good start," Tehran had firmly rejected the U.S. demand to "stop enriching uranium to 60%." Meanwhile, the U.S. Treasury Department announced new sanctions against Iranian oil shipping entities. This "talking while fighting" stance makes a full restoration of the Tehran nuclear agreement still a distant prospect.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Xinhua, Realtime News, CGTN, Al Arabiya](https://english.alarabiya.net/News/middle-east/2026/02/07/trump-says-us-talks-with-iran-very-good-more-negotiations-expected)

### 4. Arms control negotiations intensify: The United States accuses China of conducting a secret nuclear test in 2020.
- **Time**: 2026-02-07
- **Source**: The Japan Times, SCMP
- **Summary**: According to a report by The Japan Times, the day after the nuclear disarmament treaty expired, the United States dropped a bombshell at the Geneva disarmament conference. U.S. Under Secretary of State for Arms Control, Di Nanno, publicly accused China of using "decoupling" technology to conceal a low-yield secret nuclear test in 2020, reportedly yielding hundreds of tons. U.S. Secretary of State Rubio reiterated that any future arms control agreement must include China within a trilateral framework, otherwise U.S. security cannot be guaranteed. Observers point out that this move by the U.S. aims to exert diplomatic pressure on China during the nuclear control "vacuum." China has not yet responded to this latest accusation, but Beijing has repeatedly emphasized its refusal to participate in such unequal trilateral negotiations.
- **References**:
  - [1] [The Japan Times, SCMP](https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2026/02/07/asia-pacific/us-china-secret-nuclear-testing/)

### 5. Russia and India have reached a secret defense agreement involving the Su-57 fighter jet and hypersonic technology.
- **Time**: 2026-02-07
- **Source**: Bankingnews.gr
- **Summary**: According to the Greek media outlet *Bankingnews*, Russia and India recently reached a secret defense agreement that has shaken the international political arena. The agreement stipulates that Russia will provide India with five key assets, including core algorithms for hypersonic weapons, advanced aerodynamics, and nuclear technology. Most notably, the two sides plan to jointly develop and produce the fifth-generation Su-57 fighter jet. This move is seen as an attempt to establish India as a global aerospace hub and create deep synergy in defense systems. Experts analyze that during a period of global geopolitical instability, the accelerated strategic asset binding between Russia and India is clearly a response to a potential ultimatum from the Trump administration regarding the regional situation.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Bankingnews.gr](https://www.bankingnews.gr/index.php?id=853713)

### 6. The trilateral talks between Russia, Ukraine, the United States, and the United Arab Emirates have concluded, resulting in a new agreement on prisoner exchanges.
- **Time**: 2026-02-06
- **Source**: CGTN
- **Summary**: According to CGTN, the second round of trilateral diplomatic consultations between Russia, Ukraine, and the United States, hosted by the UAE, concluded successfully on Friday. A major achievement of the meeting was the signing of a new prisoner exchange agreement, seen as a positive sign of easing tensions in Eastern Europe. In addition to humanitarian issues, representatives from China, the US, and Russia also held closed-door discussions in the UAE on core issues such as global strategic stability. Although the smoke of war has not yet cleared, this diplomatic interaction demonstrates that indirect mediation through neutral international platforms is playing an irreplaceable role.
- **References**:
  - [1] [CGTN](https://www.cgtn.com/politics)

### 7. The Russian military has assembled an 87,000-strong drone force, raising concerns about a major loophole in Western chip embargoes.
- **Time**: 2026-02-07
- **Source**: Daily Mail, Kyiv Independent
- **Summary**: According to reports from the Daily Mail and the Kyiv Independent, Russia is expanding its drone warfare capabilities at an unprecedented pace. Latest intelligence indicates that Putin's newly formed "Unmanned Systems Forces" have exceeded 87,000 personnel, even surpassing the total strength of the British Army. Shockingly, Ukrainian forces recently discovered a large number of advanced microchips manufactured in the US and Europe in the wreckage of a Russian-made Geran-5 high-speed drone shot down. This suggests serious loopholes in the Western technology supply chain embargo against Russia. Furthermore, the Russian military is deploying suicide drones specifically to target the Ukrainian HIMARS system, indicating a continuous escalation of battlefield technological confrontation.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Daily Mail, News18 Hindi, Kyiv Independent](https://www.dailymail.co.uk/google-news-sitemap1.xml?requestId=)

### 8. Xi Jinping conducts multilateral diplomacy, emphasizing strategic stability between China and Russia and traditional friendship between China and Vietnam.
- **Time**: 2026-02-06
- **Source**: CGTN
- **Summary**: According to our station, Chinese President Xi Jinping has recently been engaged in a series of multilateral diplomatic activities. During meetings with relevant representatives, President Xi called on China and Russia to further deepen strategic cooperation and jointly safeguard global strategic balance. Meanwhile, in a meeting with Vietnamese representatives, he emphasized that China always prioritizes Sino-Vietnamese relations in its neighborhood diplomacy and is willing to strengthen traditional friendship. Furthermore, the 2026 New Year reception held by the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs sent a strong signal of strengthening international cooperation, demonstrating China's constructive role in the multipolarization process.
- **References**:
  - [1] [CGTN](https://www.cgtn.com/politics)

### 9. China and Uzbekistan announced the deepening of their comprehensive strategic partnership, marking a new stage in economic and trade cooperation.
- **Time**: 2026-02-06
- **Source**: CGTN
- **Summary**: According to our report, relations between China and Uruguay have recently made significant progress. Both sides formally announced their intention to jointly deepen the comprehensive strategic partnership between the two countries. During a meeting with the Uruguayan President, the head of China's top legislative body stated that China is willing to conduct in-depth cooperation with Uruguay in areas such as trade, politics, and international multilateral cooperation. Uruguay responded positively, stating that it regards China as a key strategic partner. This development reflects the continued expansion of China's circle of friends in Latin America and the deepening and solidifying of South-South cooperation.
- **References**:
  - [1] [CGTN](https://www.cgtn.com/politics)

### 10. Tensions escalate in the South China Sea: China's live-fire exercises force emergency flight diversions; Philippine aircraft intercepted at close range.
- **Time**: 2026-02-06
- **Source**: CBS News
- **Summary**: According to CBS News, tensions in the South China Sea have escalated recently. The Australian Department of Defence stated that China conducted a large-scale live-fire exercise without issuing a formal warning, forcing several civilian airliners to make emergency diversions. Meanwhile, the Philippine military accused a Chinese military helicopter of dangerously flying within 10 feet (approximately 3 meters) of a Philippine patrol aircraft over the South China Sea. US diplomats strongly condemned the incident, stating that China's use of water cannons and dangerous interception maneuvers against Philippine vessels seriously endangered lives. Currently, Australia, New Zealand, and the United States are strengthening joint monitoring of the Chinese vessel involved.
- **References**:
  - [1] [CBS News](https://www.cbsnews.com/changing-china/2/)

### 11. NATO strengthens Greenland's defenses, using diplomatic means to counter US "acquisition" intentions.
- **Time**: 2026-02-06
- **Source**: Realtime News, ICRT
- **Summary**: According to Realtime News and ICRT, NATO is taking new measures to strengthen its security presence in Greenland. Despite repeated expressions of interest from the Trump administration in acquiring Greenland, NATO allies Canada and France officially opened consulates in Nuuk, the Greenlandic capital, this week. Diplomatic observers point out that this move aims to support Denmark's sovereignty over the island with a substantial diplomatic presence. Canadian Governor General Mary Simon has stated clearly that Greenland's future should be decided by its people. These actions highlight a collective resistance within NATO to unilateral US intentions and a tightening of its security posture amidst great power rivalry.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Realtime News, ICRT, The National Pulse](https://www.icrt.com.tw/info_list01.php?&mlevel1=6&mlevel2=12)

### 12. The threat of war in the Middle East is escalating: Several European airlines have announced the suspension of flights to and from the affected region.
- **Time**: 2026-02-07
- **Source**: Daily Mail, ABNA English
- **Summary**: According to the latest news from the Daily Mail, due to the sharp escalation of geopolitical risks in the Middle East, Air France and KLM have announced the immediate suspension of all flights to Dubai, Tel Aviv, Riyadh, and other destinations, and have explicitly requested that flights avoid Iranian and Iraqi airspace. Previously, the United States had moved a carrier strike group to the region, and Iranian officials subsequently warned that any attack by the US military would trigger a "full-scale war." Furthermore, large-scale demonstrations erupted in Saada, Yemen, declaring readiness to fight against US forces. This partial "blockade" of Middle Eastern airspace has thrown international air transport into chaos.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Daily Mail, ABNA English](https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-15494001/KLM-Air-France-suspend-flights-Middle-East-Iran-warns-Trump-US-attack-mean-war.html)

### 13. India and the US deepen defense science and technology cooperation: focusing on hypersonic weapons and military AI
- **Time**: 2026-02-06
- **Source**: Indian Defence News
- **Summary**: According to Indian Defence News, the 24th India-US Joint Technical Group meeting recently concluded in New Delhi. Representatives from both sides reached several substantive agreements on implementing the "India-US Major Defence Partnership Framework" to be signed in 2025. The meeting focused on cutting-edge areas such as hypersonic weapons development, AI-driven combat systems, quantum applications, and unmanned combat platforms. The report noted that India and the US are accelerating joint innovation in next-generation missile defense and new materials, aiming to address the growing strategic threats in the Indo-Pacific region through close collaboration between industry and academia.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Indian Defence News](https://www.indiandefensenews.in/2026/02/drdo-and-us-forge-ahead-in-defence-tech.html)

### 14. The 2026 BRICS Summit will be hosted by India: committed to promoting a multipolar world and global governance reform.
- **Time**: 2026-02-06
- **Source**: The Business Standard
- **Summary**: According to the Business Standard, the 2026 BRICS summit will be hosted by India, the current rotating chair. With the organization expanding to 10 members, the BRICS nations now represent nearly 50% of the world's population and approximately 40% of its GDP. As the host, India has made it clear that this summit will focus on promoting structural reforms of core international institutions such as the UN Security Council. While G7 countries like France hope to strengthen cooperation with India to prevent the BRICS from moving towards an "anti-Western" confrontation, observers believe that the Global South is seeking to reduce its dependence on a single global hegemon through such regional security systems.
- **References**:
  - [1] [The Business Standard (TBS News)](https://www.tbsnews.net/thoughts/brics-2026-implications-multipolar-world-1344096)

### 15. Medvedev strongly criticized the US nuclear control conditions: The era of nuclear arms control is coming to an end.
- **Time**: 2026-02-06
- **Source**: EADaily
- **Summary**: According to EADaily, Dmitry Medvedev, Deputy Chairman of the Russian Security Council, expressed anger at the conditions proposed by the United States in the negotiations for the New START Treaty. He pointed out that the US attempted to forcibly include hypersonic missiles, underwater nuclear unmanned vehicles, and space weapons within the scope of restrictions, ignoring Russia's leading advantage in these emerging fields. Medvedev emphasized that, in the context of a nuclear control "vacuum," Russia will never accept any informal compromises that would harm its national security. These remarks reflect a serious rift between the US and Russia in maintaining global strategic balance, further escalating the risk of strategic confrontation.
- **References**:
  - [1] [EADaily](https://eadaily.com/en/news/2026/02/06/medvedev-was-outraged-by-the-conditions-put-forward-by-the-united-states-under-the-new-start-treaty)

### 16. Israel remains in a state of war: the military is monitoring multiple threats to the border around the clock.
- **Time**: 2026-02-07
- **Source**: Israel Today
- **Summary**: According to a special wartime report by *Israel Today*, as of the early morning of February 7th, the security situation in Israel remained at the highest alert level. The report indicated that the Israeli military was continuing its military operations in the Gaza Strip and was dynamically monitoring potential threats along the northern border and surrounding areas hourly. Currently, Israel has strengthened its air defense systems targeting civilians to counter potential long-range rocket attacks. Regional analysts believe that, due to the interconnected geopolitical situation, Israel is facing its most complex security environment since the outbreak of the conflict.
- **References**:
  - [1] Israel Today: Ongoing War Report: https://www.spreaker.com/podcast/israel-today-ongoing-war-report--5985229

### 17. Navigation warning for the Indo-Pacific region: Dangerous operations to be conducted in the South China Sea and the Mariana Islands.
- **Time**: 2026-02-07
- **Source**: NAVAREA 11 Warnings
- **Summary**: According to the latest NAVAREA XI navigation warning issued by the Japan Coast Guard, activities involving "space debris" and dangerous operations will be conducted in the southern South China Sea and the Mariana Islands waters of the North Pacific from February 11th to 12th. Reports indicate that several engineering vessels, such as the M/V ANIEK, are currently conducting submarine cable retrieval in the western North Pacific. This comes after several previous incidents of interference with critical underwater infrastructure in the South China Sea. Navigation authorities urge passing vessels to remain vigilant and avoid relevant restricted areas during this period to ensure safe navigation.
- **References**:
  - [1] [NAVAREA 11 Warnings](https://www.sealagom.com/navarea/11/)

### 18. China and Vietnam complete joint patrol in the Beibu Gulf; China's first maritime spaceport put into operation.
- **Time**: 2026-02-07
- **Source**: CGTN
- **Summary**: According to a CGTN report, the navies of China and Vietnam recently completed a routine joint patrol in the Gulf of Tonkin, aimed at maintaining navigational safety and order in the area. Regarding maritime strategic deployments, China announced the official operation of its first maritime spaceport, marking a significant leap forward in China's ability to access space from the sea. Furthermore, data shows that China's "Silk Road Maritime" network has handled over 26 million TEUs, reflecting the further consolidation of China's dominant position in the Indo-Pacific maritime trade network.
- **References**:
  - [1] [CGTN](https://www.cgtn.com/video)

### 19. Port workers in several Mediterranean countries strike in protest against geopolitical confrontation between major powers.
- **Time**: 2026-02-06
- **Source**: Anarchist Federation
- **Summary**: According to the Anarchist Association, port workers in Greece, Italy, Turkey, France, and Morocco held a 24-hour joint strike on February 6. The strike organizers explicitly opposed the geopolitical competition between the United States and its allies and China and Russia in their declaration. Workers' representatives protested the use of public port resources for military intervention plans and condemned the sovereignty struggle among major powers over energy transport routes. This transnational action reflects the strong resistance from labor organizations in the Global South to the economic damage caused by geopolitical competition.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Anarchist Federation](https://www.anarchistfederation.net/mediterranean-dockers-strike-for-palestine/)

### 20. Iran seeks to expand cooperation with Indian ports to counter pressure from US sanctions.
- **Time**: 2026-02-06
- **Source**: New Indian Express
- **Summary**: According to The New Indian Express, despite facing a new round of sanctions threats from the Trump administration, Iranian officials have expressed a strong desire to expand cooperation with India at the Chabahar port. Iran believes that strengthening the port's strategic operations is key to offsetting the impact of US sanctions. Currently, while the US Treasury Department has granted temporary exemptions for some diplomatic-related financial transactions, the overall sanctions situation remains severe. India's Ministry of External Affairs reiterated that its energy and trade policies will be made independently based on national interests and will not be swayed by external pressure.
- **References**:
  - [1] [New Indian Express, Deccan Herald](https://www.newindianexpress.com/news_sitemap.xml)

### 21. Trump pushes for reciprocal tariffs: refuses to apologize for "America First" policy.
- **Time**: 2026-02-07
- **Source**: Deccan Herald
- **Summary**: According to our reports, US President Trump took a hard line in his latest trade policy speech. He explicitly stated that he would not apologize to any country for implementing the "reciprocal tariffs" policy, which aims to balance the US's long-standing trade deficit. Meanwhile, facing pressure from the US, Bangladesh was forced to commit to reducing imports of Chinese products and increasing military purchases from the US in the latest US-Bangladesh trade agreement. Observers point out that this practice of linking trade with security is forcing many countries globally to readjust their supply chain strategies.
- **References**:
  - [1] [New Indian Express, Deccan Herald](https://www.deccanherald.com/news_sitemap.xml)

### 22. Russia acknowledges challenges to technological independence; India and the US disagree on AI rules between China and India.
- **Time**: 2026-02-06
- **Source**: UNN.ua, Deccan Herald
- **Summary**: According to Russian media outlet UNN, an internal report from the Russian Ministry of Economic Development acknowledges that Russia's goal of achieving technological independence by 2030 is facing a major setback due to its heavy reliance on imported high-tech products. In the field of artificial intelligence, cracks are emerging in the international governance framework. Both the United States and China have chosen not to join certain ethical rules governing military AI, while the Indian government, in its latest economic survey report, emphasized prioritizing the data value chain and practical applications of AI rather than pursuing symbolic international constraints. This pragmatic approach reflects the independent stance of emerging powers in technology governance.
- **References**:
  - [1] [UNN.ua, ICRT, Deccan Herald](https://unn.ua/en/authors/vadim-khlyudzinsky)

### 23. Private defense giant Top Aces expands into the Asia-Pacific region, providing adversary air training.
- **Time**: 2026-02-07
- **Source**: Flight International
- **Summary**: According to Flight International, Top Aces, a leading global private defense contractor, has announced its formal expansion into the Asia-Pacific region. The company plans to provide "adversary air services" in the region to support the high-intensity air combat training needs of the United States and its allies. This move reflects the explosive growth in demand for advanced air and sea simulation training in the Asia-Pacific defense market and also confirms the urgency felt by regional countries in enhancing their military preparedness. The involvement of private military services is becoming an emerging force in the regional security architecture.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Top Aces 进军亚太市场，提供假想敌空中支援服务](https://a.hatena.ne.jp/rosso0501/?gid=376521)

### 24. China and Vietnam successfully conducted a joint patrol in the Gulf of Tonkin: Deepening maritime security cooperation.
- **Time**: 2026-02-07
- **Source**: CGTN
- **Summary**: According to a report by CGTN, Chinese and Vietnamese naval vessels recently completed a joint patrol mission in the Gulf of Tonkin. The patrol aimed to maintain peace and order in the territorial waters and surrounding areas of both countries through routine law enforcement cooperation. The two sides exchanged views on maritime search and rescue, combating transnational crime, and protecting fishery resources. Experts analyzed that against the backdrop of overall instability in the South China Sea, the institutionalized joint patrol demonstrates the positive willingness of China and Vietnam to manage differences and deepen maritime strategic mutual trust.
- **References**:
  - [1] [CGTN](https://www.cgtn.com/politics)

### 25. India emphasizes energy independence: it will maintain its oil trade with Venezuela even in the face of external sanctions.
- **Time**: 2026-02-07
- **Source**: The Pioneer
- **Summary**: According to The Herald, a spokesperson for the Indian Ministry of External Affairs recently reiterated that India's energy policy always prioritizes national interests. Despite repeated disruptions to Venezuelan oil trade due to US sanctions, India still considers Venezuela a key energy supplier and plans to maintain its existing energy investments in Venezuela. Prime Minister Modi also stated in previous trade talks that while India values its large trade agreements with Europe and the US, it will not back down on issues concerning energy security and protecting its sensitive agricultural markets.
- **References**:
  - [1] [The Pioneer, New Indian Express](https://dailypioneer.com/news/energy-security-top-priority-india-says-amid-trump-remarks-on-oil-imports)

### 26. Iraq launches counter-terrorism operation; several ISIS militants detonate suicides in Anbar province.
- **Time**: 2026-02-07
- **Source**: ABNA English
- **Summary**: According to Iraq's ABNA news agency, Iraqi security forces conducted a special operation against remnants of the Islamic State (ISIS) in western Anbar province on Friday. During the fierce firefight, several surrounded terrorists detonated suicide bombs, killing themselves. The Iraqi Ministry of Defense stated that the operation successfully dismantled a terrorist group planning attacks on surrounding towns. This development demonstrates that even amidst escalating power struggles among major Middle Eastern nations, regional counterterrorism remains a pressing security challenge for all countries.
- **References**:
  - [1] [ABNA English](https://en.abna24.com/)

### 27. South Africa and China are close to reaching a trade agreement: African countries seek trade balance
- **Time**: 2026-02-07
- **Source**: Deccan Herald
- **Summary**: According to our Cape Town correspondent, the South African Department of Trade announced that South Africa is close to reaching a new comprehensive trade agreement with China. The agreement focuses on balancing the bilateral trade structure and increasing South African exports of high-value-added agricultural and mineral products to China. At the same time, the South African government has expressed concern about the reciprocal tariffs pushed by Trump. Observers point out that as the global trade environment becomes increasingly challenging, major African economies are accelerating their efforts to find balance among major powers, mitigating the political risks associated with fluctuations in a single market through diversified partnerships.
- **References**:
  - [1] [New Indian Express, Deccan Herald](https://www.deccanherald.com/news_sitemap.xml)

### 28. China's Ministry of Foreign Affairs hosts New Year reception: sending a new signal of win-win cooperation.
- **Time**: 2026-02-06
- **Source**: CGTN
- **Summary**: According to CGTN, the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs recently held a grand New Year reception in Beijing for 2026. Ambassadors from many countries and representatives of international organizations attended. In his address, a spokesperson for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs emphasized that in a complex and volatile international environment, China will continue to uphold multilateralism and is committed to resolving conflicts through dialogue, not confrontation. The report also noted that China released positive signals at the reception regarding further easing market access and deepening cooperation on climate governance. This move has been interpreted by the outside world as China remaining committed to maintaining the stability of global supply chains and inclusive growth while addressing complex geopolitical challenges.
- **References**:
  - [1] [CGTN](https://www.cgtn.com/politics)

### 29. The Kremlin welcomes the US-Iran dialogue, believing it will help reduce the risk of war.
- **Time**: 2026-02-07
- **Source**: Al Arabiya
- **Summary**: According to a report by Al Arabiya, the Russian government has publicly expressed its support for the recent indirect negotiations between the US and Iran held in Oman. Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov stated that despite serious differences, such dialogue is the only way to prevent the Middle East from sliding into a "full-scale war." Neighboring countries such as Azerbaijan have also welcomed the negotiations. Analysts believe that Russia's support for the dialogue at this time is both an attempt to mitigate the impact of regional conflict on its strategic assets and an effort to maintain an image as a "great power diplomacy mediator" at this delicate moment when nuclear disarmament treaties are expiring.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Al Arabiya, Taipei Times, The Hindu, AA](https://english.alarabiya.net/News/middle-east/2026/02/07/trump-says-us-talks-with-iran-very-good-more-negotiations-expected)

### 30. Unveiling the Russian-made Geran-5 drone: High-speed suicide attacks change the pace of the battlefield.
- **Time**: 2026-02-07
- **Source**: Daily Mail
- **Summary**: According to an in-depth analysis of the wreckage seized in Ukraine by the Daily Mail, Russia's newly deployed Geran-5 drones not only integrate high-end Western chips, but also boast significantly improved flight speed and stealth design. These suicide drones are currently being used by the Russian military to carry out targeted strikes against Ukrainian logistics hubs. The report quotes military experts as saying that the Russian military is using this precision-strike weapon, which is far less expensive than missiles, to deplete the Ukrainian military's expensive air defense reserves. The success of this asymmetric warfare model is forcing Western countries to re-evaluate their existing electronic warfare and short-range air defense systems.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Daily Mail, News18 Hindi, Kyiv Independent](https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-15494001/KLM-Air-France-suspend-flights-Middle-East-Iran-warns-Trump-US-attack-mean-war.html)
